result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Raul Maldonado Avila in court. Samuel Berg appears for the State of Wisconsin. Bond remains. State reviewing file. Requesting 2 weeks. Minutes filed
Hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Arrest
Signed bond filed with the court.

*AMENDED 8/17/22: NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH D.M.W. dob 5-15-1993 OR RESIDENCE. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party.*

DEFENDANT MUST POST $250 CASH (ALREADY POSTED)

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH D.M.W. dob 5-15-1993 OR RESIDENCE. If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 

22-2303 thru 22-2305
